intro: Evolvulus acapulcensis, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a herbaceous annual plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and hairy stems. The plant produces small, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color, blooming throughout the warmer months. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine pubescence, while its fruits are small, round capsules that contain numerous seeds. Evolvulus acapulcensis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
